definition: Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Tang dynasty (618-907)/surname Tang
to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs
surname Zong
"Duke Li of Wei Answering Emperor Taizong of Tang", military treatise attributed to Li Jing 李靖[Li3 Jing4] and one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
pinyin: Tang2 Tai4 zong1 Li3 Wei4 Gong1 Wen4 dui4

sentences.english: In the end the Emperor decided to temporarily stop the expedition.
sentences.chinese: 最終唐太宗決定暫時停止這次出征。

sentences.english: Tang armies under Emperor Tang Taizong was also very powerful.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗領導下的唐朝軍隊也非常強大。

sentences.english: During the reign of Emperor Taizong there was a minister named Wei Zheng.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗執政時期有一位大臣叫魏徵。

sentences.english: TangTai-zong admired Wang's calligraphy very much which consolidated the Wang's respectable position in the calligraphy field.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗推崇王羲之書法，從而奠定了王書的獨尊地位。

sentences.english: In all his life, Buddhism kept a permanent relationship with him.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗一生，與佛教有着不解的淵源。

sentences.english: Next, we'll talk about Wei Zheng, whom Emperor Taizong feared yet respected.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，我們再說那個令唐太宗又敬又畏的魏徵。

definition: Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649

first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
Emperor Gaozu of Tang, reign name of first Tang emperor Li Yuan 李淵|李渊[Li3 Yuan1] (566-635), reigned 618-626

Li Yuan, personal name of first Tang emperor Gaozu 唐高祖[Tang2 Gao1 zu3] (566-635), reigned 618-626
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
